channel.title: Development Log on Aaron McKinley Swindell | Game Developer & Artist
channel.description: Recent content in Development Log on Aaron McKinley Swindell | Game Developer & Artist

item.title: difficulty setting and play time integration
item.description: reintroduced the coding for difficulty setting and programmed a play time clock, so that I can finally see how long the gameplay itself is added the ticker to the menu and save file displays, although doing so required rebuilding a bit of the player’s prefab and animator graph.

item.title: impatient persistence
item.description: ended up restoring the project so it will be ready to go on monday

item.title: depressive boon?
item.description: was feeling the typical Sunday Sadness, so I fired up the PC to try and catch up on some of the work from last week I was planning on redoing this week.

item.title: wasted week
item.description: something I did broke the save system, not really sure what exactly, so I’ve backed everything up as it was broken and am restoring last week’s backup, which seems to work.

item.title: difficulty level reckoning
item.description: after a bit of first hand experience during my time away from the project with difficulty level, I have decided that a traditional system is indeed needed for my own game.

item.title: the headless woman & the skip button
item.description: it had been awhile since I modeled a human from scratch, so I started one to use as the final boss; shake things up a bit from the machines. progress is going smoothly, mainly because my references seem to be well crafted added a skip button for the dialogue, in case people like to die quickly and numerously.

item.title: slowly regaining momentum
item.description: it is beginning to happen though added a data privacy button for opting out and lighting effects for the desert world

item.title: feeling lousy
item.description: two or three days of depression, so I’m working on a holiday. at least it is my least favorite one, maybe second to new year’s, i suppose didn’t really do much.

item.title: swapped scripting backend
item.description: what a rough day i remember it being tricky to go back and forth between scripting backend types (mono, IL2CPP) and needing the internet to do so, but I don’t recall having so many problems!

item.title: operation: paper push
item.description: no, seriously… i think this might help all of it needs to be done anyhow mayhap a month of dreary upkeep and a return to the masses of the online roleplayers be just what the doctor ordered i should real quick build a three kit kill version for test play during this time, the level progression values as is are definitely off-putting

item.title: data safety form complete
item.description: i managed to complete Google Play’s data safety form within a day, despite my initial expectations of its difficulty. in the end, it was just a matter of hunkering down and doing it.

item.title: conclusion of operation: octo-squid
item.description: i am formally declaring (announcing?) the conclusion of operation: octo-squid. while the operation’s primary objectives will remain in place, i feel that the short-term goal the regimen was put in place to achieve has been accomplished for the time being.

item.title: hiatus drawing to a close
item.description: i can feel the pangs of art beginning to return after a month or so of respite. i think i shall try to ease myself back into the actual creative parts by working on some practical aspects, that have been neglected as of late, to begin.

item.title: with the cadence of peter lorre
item.description: what feels like an endless endeavour is slowly grinding along. better late than never, at least that’s what they say. finally published the second demo to the Google Play app store for internal testing phase 2.

item.title: painting giant beam particle textures
item.description: spent the whole week painting textures and creating shaders for the big attack for the primary attack of the second boss. had some issues with photoshop’s recognition of my wacom tablets pressure sensitivity, it was weird and I could have swore it was working.

item.title: boss ship 2 rigged
item.description: finally started setting up the second boss, it is tougher going than I had anticipated. for whatever reason, it doesn’t feel like I gave as much consideration beforehand to exactly how this particular boss would articulate what its possible attack patterns may be I then began to realise I hadn’t decided where either of the remaining two boss’ weaknesses were going to be located either.

item.title: sporadic progression
item.description: have only been able to manage to be productive every other week or so. today was the first day i felt like I worked a real day all year the terrain for planet 3 is almost done after around one full day’s work, just the baking left to do, but I have many adjustments that are still pending testing still really difficult to make myself play the game to test things.

item.title: immense suffering
item.description: have been doing terrible, but slowly getting back in the swing of things fixed a few bugs this week that weren’t game breaking and as such have been lingering around for a year or more.

item.title: extreme progression difficulty
item.description: really hard this week having so much trouble finishing this project, in general i really don’t know why there was supposed to be a December demo, but it doesn’t look like it will be on time i will get it done eventually though you betcha, you betcha

item.title: mildly winning
item.description: so, i didn’t do anything today, but the rest of the week has been most productive! i’m talking big bugs with single lines; it feels like the home stretch, but honestly it looks halfway there.

item.title: lengthy lapse
item.description: haven’t been able to force myself to work on the game for quite some time, have been on a sort of hiatus added changes to correct the energy ability items/shield ability bug, as well as fixed the energy meter spending and shield ability consumption added reset trigger parameter to player animator controller to facilitate the above basically, the animator Rebind function was resetting the animator parameters too, which i use for the shield ability.

item.title: ouchie
item.description: difficult day thought i had the new item ability system working before the weekend five hours of work later today, i think it is working. at first i thought the static variables i was using were the problem, but i ended up keeping them.

item.title: borked beyond bork
item.description: nanu, nanu once upon a time i thought i programmed this ability swapping system easy peasy fast track: reality murray’s law

item.title: many changes, most recent: item ability functional
item.description: it actually seems to work… at first test… i just can’t use old save data. idk how imma add shit and not break the save data signature… i didn’t even change it, but old files load funny.

item.title: la, la, bumba
item.description: i changed like a million things to fix a hundred… if that isn’t a saying, quote me. idk what to even test anymore december I am supposed to add all these people… the weapon change system seems good… recent adjustments to equipment strength seems appropriate… i need to figure out the relic/accessories, the ability system… what am I missing?

item.title: short cut?
item.description: today i modeled and rendered a blaster icon in an hour and a half… stark contrast to the circuit board, but it was a pretty simple model.

item.title: healing item icons complete
item.description: took awhile, but happy with the end result

item.title: boss ship 3 model complete
item.description: got the model imported, all the materials setup and the textures compressed. still need to program the fight and do attack animations

item.title: boss ship 3 textures complete
item.description: finished texturing the third boss ship model in substance painter and exported the textures. still need to setup the shaders and do the final FBX export from Maya i can’t decide if i want to continue to do the attack animations in Unity, or go a bit ahead and learn the animation and rigging pipeline, so i would already have it under my belt when i go to animate a humanoid character or anything else with a complex rig hierarchy i’d obviously want to animate in Maya hmm, indeed

item.title: uv tip
item.description: omg, this will save me so many clicks Modeling > Mesh Display > Soften/Harden Edges Options : Texture Borders

item.title: vertex color in maya
item.description: started retopologising boss ship 3 and i actually figured out a way to see the vertex color data from zbrush in Maya, which should make the process a bit more friendly and eliminate the use of TopoGun altogether.

item.title: boss ship 3 vertex color complete
item.description: starting the week out well, productivity apps seem to be helping me be aware of and provide accountability for my time. had to do a tiny bit of sculpting to reshape a few parts, i thought i was done with it at least twice, but kept finding details i missed.

item.title: holy wasted week Batman!
item.description: finished laying out the base colors for boss ship 3 in zbrush, still need to paint the decals and decimate also think the weapon effect system is working, managed to figure out a way to set the default effect when unequipping a weapon altogether, which of course wasn’t as difficult of a problem as it seemed to be, once i had written the code supposed to test the stage progression system a bit this weekend, maybe i should add in a third type first… it is good to be feeling motivated again!

item.title: groovy
item.description: actually opened up zbrush this week and got the model imported, the project started. also, started work on the weapon effect system was harder than expected to get a prototype working.

item.title: procrastinate the date
item.description: my birthday vacation seems to have inadvertently become a summer stay, either that or I’ve reached a slump. slowly, but surely i am finding fresh motive to continue. there was a bit of a temporary detour in attempt to get better internet infrastructure in my home, but in the end my efforts have proven fruitless.

item.title: bday vacay
item.description: so, almost done with my month long birthday break it officially began april 23 to play the Nier remake, still did a few things during it though edited the spawn textures for world 0, section 1 to adjust for difficulty need to start modeling items and get on with it

item.title: second section of first star world prototype
item.description: laid out spawn textures will probably need to refine ha, this is a haiku

item.title: spaceship 07 in game
item.description: another unproductive feeling week. how long did this damn model even take? has it been forever? it feels like it need to test the game and pivot back to programming next week.

item.title: spaceship 07 final low resolution model
item.description: ended up swapping to Maya halfway through retopologizing this model. sections started to get really close together, even having tried to eliminate such areas in the modeling stage i feel as though i have discovered this before, but the new Maya modeling toolkit is actually better than using TopoGun.

item.title: spaceship 07 decimated
item.description: finished up the high resolution model sculpting and vertex colouring in zBrush, got the model decimated and have started laying out the final topology in topogun had some strange issues merging subtools in z… ended up reloading a save to find a piece disappearing and reappearing, sort of flickering as the camera would rotate.

item.title: cusp versus edge: fight!
item.description: life is so difficult to navigate lately… this is coming from someone who doesn’t go anywhere or do anything except live his pursuit i am either on the cusp of something brilliant, some huge revelation or new threshold of understanding; or at the edge of some immeasurable disaster, a great unravelling of everything i have known or built and perhaps disillusion of everything that may ever come to be it is tough to say, maybe I don’t wanna label it, or speak the thought into existence progress is coming along well on the seventh spaceship.

item.title: moving forward
item.description: feeling rather unproductive, but slowly trudging along… been learning about and implementing preprocessor directives as i finish off the massive stage progression system update and world section integration, which i am still hoping will work out okay in the end; it seems to be so far the preprocessor clauses should prevent a bit of user (developer?

item.title: testing huge rewrite
item.description: finally got what i am hoping to be the major changes involved in this “huge rewrite” completed and have started testing. lots and lots of notes/bugs already, it is hard to feel like i am making progress, but these things should have been this way from the start.

item.title: huge rewrite in progress
item.description: making everything the way it should have always been. am learning a lot and also realizing how much i have already. you know you wrote some sexy code, when what you added to the code base is less than you removed and it does MORE stuff… the stuff you really want

item.title: the feeling of fruitlessness
item.description: feeling ultra unmotivated this feels like such a wasted week… or weeks, maybe? i really did do some constructive things, but life is really hard dealing with death. i miss him already.

item.title: boss ship 2 initial topology done
item.description: still need to get the count down a bit and lay out the UVs in Maya, then texture and a tiny bit of rigging

item.title: deja poo
item.description: almost finished the final low resolution model within the year, tired of clicking. gonna look back and see what i was working on a year ago, exactly. hopefully doesn’t make me too sad, hahah

item.title: progresso?
item.description: finished the hummingbirds course. also completed the decimation/export process from zBrush and got the low-res model going. managed to use some of the old topology from spaceShip 5, so have a decent start not sure why i feel like i didn’t do anything, that sounds productive doesn’t it?

item.title: boss 2 zBrush complete
item.description: finished the hi-res painting and sculpting for the second boss ship model. i have gotten a decent collection of generic alpha shapes over the course of this project and am getting used to using zremesher on everything i need to paint on monday i plan to decimate the model and begin topology construction to get the poly count of the final low-res mesh as low as possible.

item.title: boss 2 sub-D complete
item.description: didn’t get a lot of time to work on the actual project this week, spent most of my time studying. hopefully get the zBrush work done next week at least, who knows

item.title: hello machines
item.description: i guess the machine learning seminar i took got me thinking started playing with the ML-Agents package in Unity. idk if I am hoping I can somehow program robots to finish the game for me, or if I am just bored and needed some new influx of input it is definitely intriguing and I’m surprised how quickly the agents could outperform me.

item.title: create + learn
item.description: been working on the boss ship 2 model, hi-res almost done changed out my learning.regiment from Unity’s artificial intelligence course to an intro to the ML-Agents package, the hummingbirds. it seems to incorporate new solutions to traditional AI problems, which should keep my brain seeking and growing, while potentially finding some new behavior for an enemy or possibly balancing out some mechanics for the game time will tell, but i feel the influx of new ideas, practices and technologies to be crucial to developing

item.title: long time, no production
item.description: i feel like i’ve lost weeks! in actuality, it’s probably been about a week… in total, over the course of several weeks, but i still feel behind i’ve done numerous things and added functionality that has been on my list for a long time, but i feel like i’m really just avoiding the most pressing concern of modeling more stuff, namely the second boss i did add models for different ore items for selling and did some further delving into the shader graph, to get a more appealing metallic material with just a bit of fresnel from the graph.

item.title: homerun
item.description: got planet 2 rudimentary implementation going. i had a few problems wrapping my head around this particular bit of my old code, due to not having looked at it in almost a year.

item.title: unwritten words
item.description: i think i need to start documenting more things in this log… working on the second terrain and i realised i couldn’t really remember the exact workflow i used, just a couple notes on the polygon count that were actually misleading after digging into the old project files.

item.title: dressed like a cat
item.description: two steps forward and three steps back. seems like every time i fix something, i break it later. why must this be? more problems unequipping things… at least i finally replicated the issue; it will only occur on the first stage.

item.title: level complete 2.0
item.description: the level complete screen now displays loot obtained during the level, it seems to work. the list of lootObtained is in the Playercontroller class and it gets reset in both the Save/ResetStageGrowth methods.

item.title: hey self
item.description: note to self: all hell breaks loose on title and map if the LevelComplete animator parameter is set to displayed i wonder why?

item.title: consumption function, wtf-tion
item.description: added logic for resetting the player’s inventory/equipment on death to the state it was when the stage began my first thoughts were to add the items consumed to a list when used, then add them back into the inventory on retry, but through further consideration i realised there would be issues with equipment and that i should probably save/restore that along with the inventory.

item.title: make it make more sense
item.description: you’d think this sort if thing would be more obvious from a design standpoint, but it’s the kind of thing you need to learn first hand or have previous experience, i guess anyway, after questioning the entire health orb mechanic now that healing inventory items work, i came to the conclusion the drop conditions should just be adjusted.

item.title: creative angst
item.description: entered another phase of indecision shop system seems to work, although it still needs UI animation the gameplay itself also needs balancing; to address this i have begun leaning on my favorite pillar of design philosophy, research!

item.title: terrestrial research
item.description: been looking into procedurally generating desert landscapes and generally brushing up on my terrain skills in general. hard to believe i was already two versions behind when i made the landstrip for the first planet haven’t discovered anything immediately useful, but maybe something i can put to use for one of the later planets

item.title: little bit of saturday work
item.description: i guess it was bugging the crap out of me, no pun intended, so i ended up fixing the inventory issue i was having in build turns out, for whatever reason the old saveData was invalid.

item.title: shop alpha and item use
item.description: i guess the shop is now in alpha stage, ready for testing. it still needs animation, but that will come with beta. buying and selling seem to work had problems serializing a list of item class, then i realised that its normal, i guess?

item.title: help! i can't count
item.description: saturday work have i tried to work on a saturday before and not found success? feels familiar, but i suppose failure in general should… it’s okay, i am not insane yet; but i am getting there.

item.title: slider & input field link script
item.description: worked on a sunday that was probably a mistake feel okay anyway, i like the script i wrote after posting it here, it looks like the entire for loop is unnecessary, after adding in the ValueChanged function maybe i should just keep it as a sort of insurance policy?

item.title: shop system buy interface
item.description: got the UI for the shop system’s buy function pretty much locked down, anchors work for stretching screen width and everything. still need to do the sell portion and write all the functionality, of course; but i feel more confident about it now overall for some reason getting to the point i am now, confounded me for two entire days last week and worried me all weekend.

item.title: the late bird gets the shrimp
item.description: more lost time! hurray, hurrah! after loosing around a week due to my refusal to work without air conditioning, today was the first day i was back in full capacity. unfortunately, more poor weather has me returning to my studies, as well as a bit of logging and blogging rain, rain, go away; why can’t i think of another cliché?

item.title: project woe
item.description: having issues projecting hires geometry on to low, once again lol i think I just need to add more edges. given the use case of this model, I’m leaving it as is.

item.title: retopologizing day 3
item.description: i am writing this the morning of the fourth day actually, topology always takes more time than i plan for. i managed to get the model itself done, but it is still lacking UVWs the plan for today is just to get them done, maybe i will make it as far as to bring the model into substance painter to bake the base maps and check for projection errors.

item.title: retopologizing day 2
item.description: currently stopped again from thunder, model approximately 2/3 done. i wonder how much concern is warranted and how much is paranoia in regard to lightning frying electronics i keep reminding myself to just get the mesh out as quickly as possible and that i will still optimize it in maya before laying out the UVW, but it is hard to altogether keep myself from considering topology.

item.title: retopologizing day 1
item.description: didn’t have a ton of time to work today, about a third of the way through the model spent yesterday decimating everything and exporting different detail levels from zBrush

item.title: shrimp on shrimp action
item.description: with the majority of yesterday lost to thunder and a surprise visitor, it was somewhat annoying to have another thunderous day in south Florida. i ended up back on track rather than ahead of schedule.

item.title: the latest in shrimp tech
item.description: still a few more details to sculpt before painting the vertex color tomorrow and decimating for export. should be able to get it done and start retopolgising Friday, putting me about a day ahead of my schedule… still don’t see having it done quicker than my normal two weeks, but meh

item.title: seemingly on track
item.description: got the ship into zBrush and have started remeshing the pieces i need to sculpt/paint on; the sound of looming thunder has thwarted my progress once more, for now. i can definitely feel my years of experience paying off with zBrush.

item.title: shrimp progress
item.description: i was seriously hating this monday. by the end of day 2, i was happy enough to carry on to zBrush the next day

item.title: world 2 shrimp
item.description: started work on the enemy ship for the second planet. took the time to go ahead and select designs for the rest of what i have planned for the game plenty of assets to art up still while I’m happily awaiting feedback.

item.title: website and demo live
item.description: nobody knows yet, but they are both up there and waiting; site took about two weeks, first actual demo release. not sure about how to release them yet, maybe i should have another screenshoot

item.title: great forbode
item.description: the time draws near

item.title: the little shrimps
item.description: i forgot about the little ships! still shooting for Friday demo release, been too long and have had so much progress. managed to get them integrated in pretty quickly, but was having an issue appling the tilt.

item.title: almost
item.description: lots of headway, the time for release draws nearer. stupid things tripping me up lately, but i guess it’s all part of the process. today for example, i learned trigger events will still register for disabled colliders and even if the whole gameObject is disabled.

item.title: what reginald meant
item.description: idk if the new regiment is increasing or decreasing my productivity. i am still getting things checked off, but it is difficult to gauge whether or not it is an improvement honestly, i’m not even sure i’ve followed it at all this week; but it is good to still have a general idea of the direction i should be moving

item.title: operation: octo-squid
item.description: i made a new regiment and tried to schedule my time for the day, taking into account my new goals i’m basically breaking the day into two sections, one for study and one for self-learning.

item.title: two weeks off
item.description: today was first day I’ve tried working on the game in a few weeks. kinda felt good, but I tried to keep it simple for the first day back at.it. still working on the first boss’ attack pattern.

item.title: hit boxes and attack loop logic
item.description: made a neat animated material to indicate the weak areas of the boss… they glow. still need to adjust the colliders a bit, i think. started to create the attack loop logic.

item.title: boss battle
item.description: laid out the boss UI yesterday, designed it the day before began implementation of boss battle mechanics. currently the boss is attackable and has an entrance followed by looping attack animation.

item.title: currency sfx and bugfixes
item.description: made a PlayRandom function that plays a randomized AudioClip from one of my AudioClipSet scriptableobjects. also randomizes the pitch. created five samples to use from a long open source clip i found online someone made with pocket change.

item.title: begin official spring/summer vacation/birthday break/personal development hiatus!
item.description: yeah, all that stuff rolled into one. we’ll see how long it can last without me starting to feel like a waste-case. the original plan was for a month long duration, April 10th through May, however my FF7R shipment didn’t arrive on time so I got off to a bit of a late start, hahah.

item.title: currency and level stat bonuses
item.description: i keep going back and forth between feeling really accomplished and totally unproductive. can my disposition be attributed to the current pandemic the world faces? who knows? the level stat bonuses and currency collection actually add a refreshing dynamic to the game loop and drive the player to perform other behaviors than just attack and dodge.

item.title: save system progress
item.description: nearing initial phase of save system completion at which point testing can finally begin still need a good solution for controlling the world map state. everything is coming together, it’s just taking a long time

item.title: new norm?
item.description: still working on save system when it’s busy like this, it seems like i am only able to log around once a week having doubts about the project think I’ve been working on it too long

item.title: save system alpha
item.description: kinda complicated shit going on at this stage. ended up using two static variables, a bool and a byte, to keep track of isLoading state and a selected save slot index.

item.title: stage select UI done, save system otw
item.description: feels like long time since last update again i guess i don’t chronicle my exploits much when they mostly go smoothly anyhoo, a lot has happened instead of typing I’ll just tease my progress with a GIF, like the pros… should prolly get used to that anyway wonder how much space LJ allows for uploads?

item.title: wowzers
item.description: long time, no entry… at least not a proper one. still working on the map, it is almost complete, or at least functional having a few issues when hopping in and out of levels, couple values not being reset properly… but all the core operability i was worried about seems to be working… just needs a few tweaks the info system i made from the modal panel seems to be working.

item.title: more world map
item.description: still plucking away

item.title: whurralds
item.description: a world map is a map of the world, so i guess i’ve been working on the worlds map… a map of the worlds, heh i have been worrying about it quit a bit and luckily it looks like once again Unity has some magic up its sleeve.

item.title: something said for difficulty
item.description: restart or retry means you redo kinda laughing a bit at that line here. before it just kind of restarted the spawn loop, reset your position and healed you up. now, any experience you obtained while playing the stage is lost when you either manually restart the level, or die and try agsin funny that it took as much effort as it did, perhaps that is a symptom of modern gamedev… some strange snafu when something oft considered an aged, old fashioned type of mechanic or functionality is actually harder to implement than a more sophisticated mainstream approach a time worn game rule: you die; you go back.

item.title: roundtrip
item.description: seems like destroying the persistent player on the loading screen when returning to the title screen solved the issue i was having with the modal window as a bonus, it appears that when i was working through all the ADB errors yesterday trying everything i could, i fixed a few bugs i had no idea how to tackle not sure how i should proceed tomorrow.

item.title: redone redos
item.description: i kinda feel like i am continually fixing the same problems over and over maybe thats just what development feels like? i can’t really be sure yet, the process is still rather new to me i hope with experience, i learn to write more easily extensible code.

item.title: life interference
item.description: been pretty chaotic lately managed to get the level system growth curve implementation going… only the experience is working currently, but the stats should be much the same i’m not sure if the data structure I was working on for saving level progress is going to work… I should probably look into serializing the scriptable object itself instead of copying the relevant info into a class specifically for saving restarting the level picks up from the correct iteration now and the quit button has a map and gameplay context.

item.title: the gears are turning
item.description: spent the majority of the day trying to implement a data structure for keeping track of level completion. i tried to keep things as simple as possible, thinking it a simple task.

item.title: website update
item.description: need to get in the habit of updating my blog entries monthly or something… too many duplicates to remove. didn’t get a whole lot done today, had to fix up a package for an item that sold on eBay.

item.title: ease in
item.description: finishing up a bit early today, due to it being a good stopping point and that i am satisfied with my progress. it wasn’t exactly a full day, but some of the changes were pretty big, as far as helpfulness and consideration, even if they were small in terms of effort or actual work.

item.title: retroactive update
item.description: things got crazy toward the end of the week, so i am posting what was meant to be Friday’s entree a day backdated. i went from thinking i had irrevocably broken things and having to loose a week’s worth or so of work from going in the wrong direction, to almost getting the exact functionality i was looking for.

item.title: broke too soon
item.description: only halfway through the day i found so many problems with the code i posted yesterday more restructuring today created a WorldLevel class to hold level information, such as the level spawn position texture, a level complete bool and a ScriptableObject array for that level’s dialogue all this rework comes with implementing save functionality fully.

item.title: data system work
item.description: more structural changes and minor fixes began the final implementations of the data saving system refactored the player’s level system a bit so the design makes more sense and will be more workable in the future it is now directly accessible from the player script, as opposed to being handled by the game controller.

item.title: slight fixes and remixes
item.description: corrected the loading issue i had, as well as one with the menu/back button; it should work for every case now. then i got a bit distracted maybe, maybe not… i needed more music anyway, but it felt like it took too long to make or something.

item.title: the week of waste
item.description: went back to original loading screen code, for the most part. tried to optimize and consolidate different methods for fading scenes. still feel like i am loosing frames during the loading process, at this point i no clue which code has better performance.

item.title: asynchronous struggle
item.description: been struggling… all week, really trying to get the procedurally generated map to load without the huge hiccup i am currently experiencing almost 20k milliseconds of hiccup, to give a better idea of magnitude here currently doing builds and trying to get more friendly with the profiler.

item.title: shader improvements, anyone? reflections maybe? some fresnel, perhaps?
item.description: totally off course, but what the hey; perfect example of why i’ll probably never finish the game. maybe i needed a break from the regiment, a slight deviation from the plan.

item.title: further refinement
item.description: hard day today started out fixing a few trickle down effect issues from restructuring I’ve inadvertently been going through this week. also shortened the tutorial further, trying to make it more concise removed the command character, thought maybe I’d save him for the appearance of the first live enemies seemed overly complex to stop the spawn loop on player death

item.title: decoupling and dependency reduction
item.description: spent this entire week reworking the overall layout of my UI. i am really not sure if this new approach is more performant, but after taking the holiday break and looking at the structure of my project with new eyes, it feels like a more organized way of doing things (see subject).

item.title: stage complete screen progress
item.description: got the basic flow going afraid it is going to get complicated when i start to implement saving and level restart. its been kind of a simple solution thus far of reloading the scene file, but that may have to change soon.

item.title: started level complete screen and more dialogue improvement
item.description: fixed the need for manual line returns by reworking the dialogue controller a bit based on a video made by textmeshpro. took a few hours to make it work and a lot of experimentation, but it works and the code doesn’t feel hacky.

item.title: dialogue progress
item.description: got the back and forth working with the game and dialogue controllers. still needs a bit of refining. essentially i used a black pixel (for now) in the level spawn texture to trigger conversations from an array of scriptable objects.

item.title: development resumption
item.description: i have resumed work on the game for the year. today was hard. at first, it seemed like the house of cards i have slowly been building was collapsing before my very eyes; but then it all started to make sense again.

item.title: let the people be free
item.description: decided to take a winter break Google tells me the kids are off from Dec.23 to to the 3rd of 2020. sounds great on paper, or in type, or whatever.

item.title: r&d
item.description: been taking the weekends off fairly consistently as of late. although that does not necessarily mean not working on the game, although it technically kinda does. this may seem confusing, but i have been using the weekends for inspiration and learning.

item.title: r&d
item.description: been taking the weekends off fairly consistently as of late. although that does not necessarily mean not working on the game, although it technically kinda does. this may seem confusing, but i have been using the weekends for inspiration and learning.

item.title: started developing dialogue system
item.description: so i decided it was time for dialogue in my the game. seeing as how ive been coding everything from the ground up, i naturally looked toward this approach again. a bit of explanation is probably in order here.

item.title: back button
item.description: spent most of the day implementing the Android back button read it was a requirement to be featured on Google Play Games, so I figured better do it now, rather than later when things get hairy

item.title: return to research
item.description: returned to my Houdini training have to finish up the last couple chapters even though I suppose I started to loose interest because I’d absorbed most of the techniques, I think it’s important to finish out the course

item.title: feedback *tap, tap* (repeat 400x)
item.description: so many great suggestions already and only one tester! creating with Unity gives me the freedom to design the game systems any way I want, but hearing straight up from another gamer what would be cooler in terms of design is amazing.

item.title: officially started internal testing and integrated google play game services
item.description: big steps! implemented Google Play Games Services for the game, the only thing left to add in is cloud save. did it all surprisingly quickly; so far it has taken less than a week, granted the instructions i’m following say it should take about an hour.

item.title: solar eclipse of the heart
item.description: a full circle strange sort of things occuring lately attempting to go fully procedural for the planet creation with the help of a great series by Sabastain Lague. in retrospect, even though i have slowly been discovering the many benefits of working procedurally, i didnt exactly know this sort of thing was possible directly in Unity without some sort of third party implementation.

item.title: everybody say hello
item.description: bit of a whirlwind lately went from having a mental creativity block to various progress on multiple fronts the process is still in progress, but I think I finally figured out how to solve the issues I was having upgrading to the Light Weight Render Pipeline in Unity.

item.title: Houdini modeling practice
item.description: the Houdini course I’m taking on uDemy that I got for free is actually put together really well. the instructor repeatedly drills the same techniques, preformed in slightly different manners and contexts, and goes over every aspect thoroughly… at least at first.

item.title: first world terrain and player leveling system implemented
item.description: got the seams out of the terrain, just decided ’eff it and painted them out in Photoshop. what was weird was I still had some kinda seam between the tiles, but a bit of overlap where the tile repeats took care of the job.

item.title: double side tracked
item.description: i couldn’t stand it anymore so i took a brief reprieve from learning Houdini; two days, to be exact. i decided to give myself a midterm of sorts, seeing as I am around halfway through the course.

item.title: skillSet.Enhance();
item.description: it is getting harder and harder to not feel like i am wasting time here. every day that passes, where i don’t touch Unity, feels like a wasted opportunity. this seem to zip, whoosh and click when i am programming; but DCC is a completely different animal, almost a hostile one… a hostile sloth, if there is such a thing.

item.title: new monitors and slight detour
item.description: the new monitors look great and overall I am happy with my decision to buy them. still getting the proper position and angle nailed down; first time ever having two displays that match, so it kinda feels like i have to shift over, rather than turn my head, if the position isn’t just right.

item.title: ordered new equipment and inventory progress
item.description: bought two 27 inch monitors off ebay with eBay earnings. tweaked the inventory UI a bit, made the item slot frames thinner by increasing PPU and added equipment type labels to the equipment panel.

item.title: more of the same
item.description: didnt get much time to work on it today, but i implemented the calculation for player damage dealt to use the new character stats and actually be effected by equipment, so it feels big to be able to hit a character button, equip a weapon and see an immediate increase in damage.

item.title: web presence and inventory integration
item.description: starting a new once a week commitment to building a web and social media presence for my projects. have officially signed up as a Google Play developer under the name Tetrachord.

item.title: inventory
item.description: things have been really hard going these last few days. I don’t know if I am slipping or if the learning curve just ramped itself up. been following an excellent set of lessons and have been trying to refactor and comment a bit as i go; i thought it would help me understand how complex systems like the ones I’m used to interacting with in just about every game I like, are created and designed.

item.title: wow
item.description: hard day rect transforms and anchors and nested objects

item.title: inventory and character stats work
item.description: been working on the inventory and character stats for about a week now, it is coming along well, but not without some struggle… i suppose it is always that way.

item.title: more ah-ha
item.description: scriptable objects, scriptable objects… holy crap, scriptable objects! how many times have i overlooked articles or videos regarding this topic because i thought i already knew what they were. oh, how wrong i had been.

item.title: health pickup and more; an ah-ha moment
item.description: i’ve struggled with a lot over the past few days…actually still a few battles in progress i haven’t yet won. i want to focus on something good, the sort of ah-ha moment i had sometime after watching a tutorial video mimicking the Mario Odyssey kingdom select menu.

item.title: messing with world map/world select
item.description: lots of headaches trying to follow an online example… eventually tracked down the culprit accidental - but progress

item.title: setup a high score table
item.description: topic have not implemented yet. took like three days of monkeying around.

item.title: sfx and -2 to do list
item.description: health bars and damage blinking effect added to all asteroid prefabs. did this really quickly after already finding out mecanim is the easiest route and discovering the power of the Prefab Variant.

item.title: tons of progress :D
item.description: love logs like the one i am about to write. it feels like i got so much done in so little time… or maybe time has been flying by. woke up at 5 am this morning with my mind itching and have just called it quits.

item.title: more damage/heal progress
item.description: spent most of the day fixing a bug with the damage effects… think i finally got it sorted out. it was a problem with the way my health tank system works.

item.title: damage/heal function progress
item.description: “85% of the time, it works every time.” -dev idk, where the actual quote is from, but i know the sentiment well. i am reluctant to say the methods are complete because i have thought this to be the case many,many times this week, but they seem to be working… for now.

item.title: still programming damage/heal functions
item.description: well, its been all week in my case and still not fully working. granted there has been hurricane prep and helping rents get the house refinanced in the time allotment too, but it seems to be taking forever.

item.title: foray into 3D animation in Unity
item.description: i have begun the journey… coming from UDK in college, Unity’s implementation of 3D animation pipeline seems light-years ahead of my experience with Unreal, granted this was before Unreal Engine 4.

item.title: uvw and textures bossShip_01 done
item.description: laid out the uv’s and textured the base section of the first boss model. really nice how quick this process is nowadays.

item.title: uvw and texture progress on bossShip_01
not finished > no progress
item.description: i can’t believe its been a week and this model isn’t retopologized yet. to be fair, i lost a few days this week to unexpected circumstances, but i really thought it could be done by today and i am still working on topology… when topology doesn’t even matter.

item.title: boss model decimated
item.description: cannot believe this is all i really got done today! kinda upset about it. was having a lot of issues getting meshes to decimate. they would either disappear or start to blink randomly when viewed from certain angles.

item.title: zBrush painting/sculpting done
item.description: finished the painting and sculpting i needed to do in zBrush, which wasn’t much. my zBrush phase now consists of: vertex painting material IDs for Substance Painter, making sure the various forms and layering of subtools are watertight for retopology in Topogun with the good ‘ol move brush, and lastly, decimating everything into a more bitesized polygon count and merging it all into a single subtool.

item.title: boss (spaceShip_004) high res done
item.description: finished the high resolution model for the first boss model and got everything into zBrush and organized into appropriate subtool grouping. this time i am merging more subtools together that are similar/same base color and do not require any additional vertex painting.

item.title: boss high poly modeling almost done
item.description: second day of modeling… really didn’t do much yesterday, but was pretty productive today. always seems like it just takes a bit of time for the form to sink in.

item.title: study and a return to dcc
item.description: didn’t do anything yesterday starting to think taking a break every now and again after long periods of perserverence is actually necessary today I didn’t do much either. spent some time studying up on things i will need to know later, like data persistence and started the first boss model.

item.title: basic framework fully implemented
item.description: most of the basic functionality you’d expect from a game interface is in place, the modal window is functioning properly and has been customized further to allow for momentary in-game announcements as well.

item.title: modal window done; audio controller implemented
item.description: the model window is done and seems to be functioning properly. i even adjusted it a bit to allow for an even more generic version with no buttons and just text that i can use for my ready and game over panels.

item.title: working on generic window
item.description: been working on a generic sort of window/panel for a few days now.

item.title: autofire glitch, really really fixed this time
item.description: i realised that somehow when i thought i fixed my autofire glitch i had going on, i also made the player uncontrollable during the ready phase at the start of each level.

item.title: restless night turned early morning
item.description: i felt like i got a good amount done yesterday, so i am not sure why sleep was so elusive last night. i even squashed the automatic fire glitch i was getting upon level restart after player death.

item.title: enemy health bars
item.description: got the health system working, i think… or implemented on one enemy at least. really happy about getting it going in one day. there are some really good examples of this online and some really bad ones too, much like everything on the internet i suppose.

item.title: dealt by number
item.description: finally got the damage popup text to work… was definitely a bit of a struggle. i had to hack together a few different examples i found online and basically get it working my own way.

item.title: added UI sound and audio control
item.description: i have come to loathe rain… it means getting no work done until i am able to invest in a larger UPS. wasn’t a complete loss of a day though, i did manage to get the audio settings panel hooked up and working.

item.title: small player input upgrade, not sure the UI will ever be done
item.description: i guess i’m making progress, but it feels like i keep fixing the same things over and over again. also feels like there has got to be a more elegant way to accomplish what i am trying to pull off.

item.title: ...more UI and Mecanim...
item.description: i have concluded triggers aren’t what i want for displaying UI elements… at least with my current understanding of them. during my testing i used a single trigger to flip between visibility states and encountered what i now call “the double-click problem”.

item.title: UI refinement? Mecanim xp? Idk
item.description: after deciding i needed more research and not knowing where to begin i looked at the Unity Learn pages and read everything I could find on the Animator component and Mecanim.

item.title: need more power
item.description: spent the entire day hacking away at a solution for fading between scenes and using a loading bar. feeling pretty helpless. created a bunch of problems thinking i know how to code and spent more time trying ideas out than actually getting things done.

item.title: level 1 background music complete
item.description: spent the majority of the day creating a background music loop for the first stage/world of my game. overall, i got this done way faster than i expected and am pleased.

item.title: bare bones menu/pause implemented
item.description: i feel like a lot of progress has occured since my last DevLog. i have been working on the menu system for my game and have a rudimentary build already playable on my phone.

item.title: first enemy type finished and began UI
item.description: decent progress today, finished implementing the first enemy type… definitely makes the game more difficult, hah. i also stated work on the UI, by creating custom 9-sliced sprites i rendered from hi-res geometry made in Maya and composited in Photoshop.

item.title: learnt unity particle system and created engine fx
item.description: spent some time learning the Unity particle system Shuriken… its really not THAT much different from what i was used to from Unreal Engine 3 in college. i created the player and enemy engine fx.

item.title: finished texturing first enemy ship type
item.description: textured the entire first enemy ship in less than a day. very impressed with Substance Painter.

item.title: decided to forego Unity's SRP, at least for this project
item.description: being lazy doesn’t pay off. i thought i could take a shortcut by using Unity’s new LWRP and Shader Graph for animating materials but it turned into a long cut. had nasty lighting seams all over my models.

item.title: finished retopologizing first enemy type
item.description: so, i guess you really do need containing edges everywhere you have an extreme angle. this second ship, i went a little less liberal with the edge count and i wound up with projection errors.

item.title: began first enemy ship type model
item.description: i have begun work on the first of what will probably be many enemy spaceship models. it always takes longer than expected. i thought this would be a simple one, but working with only an aerial reference leads to quite a lot of figuring in the other two dimensions.

item.title: joystick controller sprite finished
item.description: took longer than i would have expected to generate the user interface sprites for the movement controller in my game, but it is done and it works well. i rendered it from 3D in Maya to make it look nice and consequently had to learn some of the new nodes the Arnold renderer uses.

item.title: decided to test game with proper builds as opposed to Unity Remote
item.description: for whatever reason, getting the editor to see my device (Pixel 2) on the Unity Remote app is a bit clumsy, at best. i’m not really too sure how i even got it to work.

item.title: tried like hell to test mobile input using Unity Remote
item.description: so, i went through a bit of an ordeal setting up Unity Remote, i wanted to test out the mobile controls i have been working on for the game on an actual touchscreen device.

item.title: nailed down importing FBX files with PBR textures pre-attached into Unity
item.description: extensive sleep alluded me i think i figured out the whole importing into unity with embedded materials thing save the textures into the unity project with the same name (convention?) first.

item.title: research
item.description: been doing a lot of inadvertent research into newer character production pipelines than i am familiar with. i feel i have been stagnant for too long and my workflow was possibly dated before i learnt it in college, so progress is progress.

item.title: what's in the cage?
item.description: had a little problem trying a new technique that seemed solid beforehand. i needed some asteroids for the project so, thinking it would be a fairly simple model, i thought to try a little change-up in my workflow in attempt to expedite the process.

item.description: been doing a series of tests regarding how to properly compute tangents between unity and substance painter. thought i had everything figured out until i realized some information i was referencing was slightly out of date.
